title: Fix frontend build errors and remove client-side admin-token initialization

requirements.summary: Resolve frontend build/runtime failures by removing admin-token initialization and aligning frontend typings with the non-admin backend API so core chat flows work end-to-end.
acceptanceCriteria: A clean build completes successfully for both backend and frontend (no TypeScript/Vite errors; no Motoko compile errors).
A deployment run completes successfully and results in a reachable frontend with the app shell rendering.
Core flows load without runtime errors in the browser console: rooms list renders, entering a room renders chat, and sending a message works.

file_operations.description: Remove the admin-secret bootstrap call and any dependency on the secret URL parameter so the actor creation matches the non-admin backend API. Keep using the existing core infrastructure actor creation (`createActorWithConfig`) for authenticated/anonymous actors. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

Update the generated backend type declarations to no longer require or expose admin-role management methods (e.g., role assignment/admin checks) so TypeScript reflects the updated canister interface and builds cleanly.

Remove or neutralize admin-token-specific documentation/usage expectations (e.g., references to caffeine admin tokens) and ensure remaining helpers are still used safely by the app (no behavior change required beyond admin-token removal).
Remove unused/placeholder admin hook file to avoid accidental future imports and keep the codebase aligned with the removal of admin functionality.
Remove unused/placeholder admin management hook file to avoid accidental future imports and keep the codebase aligned with the removal of admin functionality.
Remove the unused/placeholder admin password prompt component so the frontend no longer contains admin-access UI artifacts.
Remove the unused/placeholder admin page so the frontend no longer contains admin-only navigation targets.
